page.title: 05 The Village of St Minver
page.content: The oldest part of the village stretches from{St Minver House northwards to the crossroads. All the houses were once owned by the squire, but were sold in 1965 when the estate was sold. The main settlement now consists of 17{privately_owned properties and 8 council houses. Five of the homes are occupied by retired people. The winter population of the village is{58,}17 of whom are children. The local{blacksmith's forge has been converted into a garage. The only shop is the{Post Office}which also sells sweets, batteries and cards. The pub and the{Cricket Club are the main social centres in the evenings. The{Perceval Institute}is the parish hall where the{Over Sixties {Club}and other functions are held. Very few people who live in St Minver work in the village.
